title: Royal Statement on Epstein Revelations Amid Scrutiny
summary: Prince William and Princess Catherine have issued their first public statement expressing deep concern over the latest revelations about Jeffrey Epstein, emphasizing their focus on the victims. This comes as new documents related to Epstein, a convicted sex offender, have been released in the US, bringing increased scrutiny on Prince Andrew, who had a long-standing friendship with Epstein. The statement was released by Kensington Palace as William prepared for a significant diplomatic visit to Saudi Arabia, aiming to address the damaging headlines and shift attention to his official duties. While the statement did not directly mention Andrew, Epstein, or Sarah Ferguson, it reflects the Royal Family's attempt to manage public perception amidst ongoing allegations. Historically, the royals have been cautious in commenting on Andrew's ties to Epstein, with the King previously stripping Andrew of titles and Prince Edward referencing victims in recent remarks. The release of this statement is seen as a strategic move to demonstrate awareness and compassion, though it may not fully resolve questions about the family's handling of the scandal.
